mdRecord.dcterms:description: Blackwell is a large house in the English Lake District, designed in the Arts and Crafts style by Baillie Scott. It was built 1898â€“1900, as a holiday home for Sir Edward Holt, a wealthy Manchester brewer. ... Blackwell has survived with almost all its original decorative features intact, and is listed grade I as an outstanding example of British domestic architecture. The house is furnished with original furniture and objects from the period. -- https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blackwell_(historic_house) [work]
